text: Chinon is a French commune. It is in the west of the Indre-et-Loire department in the Centre-Val de Loire region, to the southwest of Paris, and is a subprefecture in the department. It is also the capital of the arrrondissement of Chinon and the administrative centre of the Chinon canton. Chinon is in the valley of the Loire river, registered as a UNESCO World Heritage Site since 2000. ==History== The historic town of Chinon is on the banks of the Vienne river about from where it joins the Loire. ==Geography== The city of Chinon is along the Vienne river, near the confluence with the Loire river. The commune has an area of . Its average altitude is ; at the city hall, the altitude is . The distances from Chinon to other cities are: * Paris, the national capital - ; * Tours, the departmental capital - ; * Strasbourg - ; * Reims - ; * Bordeaux - ; * Toulouse - ; * Montpellier - ; * Lyon - ; * Nantes - ; * Marseille - . Chinon and its neighboring communes The commune of Chinon is surrounded by the communes: ===Climate=== The climate of Chinon, in the Köppen climate classification, is Cfb - Oceanic climate with template summers. ==Population== The inhabitants of Chinon are known, in French, as Chinonais (women: Chinonaises). With a population of 8,073, Chinon has a population density of inhabitants/km2. It is part of the intercommunality Chinon, Vienne et Loire (). ==Gallery== File:Chateau de Chinon SE 01.jpg|The Château de Chinon, and the Vienne river. File:RChinon.jpg|Street in Chinon.
